question_text: What is a jumper reset and how do you safely perform this procedure on a motherboard?
answer_options: Software command that remotely resets BIOS settings through operating system
Physical jumper on motherboard to clear CMOS - move jumper to reset position for 10-15 seconds
Network protocol that allows remote BIOS configuration management
Automatic process that occurs when system detects hardware configuration changes
correct_answer: Physical jumper on motherboard to clear CMOS - move jumper to reset position for 10-15 seconds
explanation: A jumper reset uses a physical jumper on the motherboard to clear CMOS/BIOS settings. Procedure: 1) Power off and unplug system, 2) Ground yourself, 3) Locate CMOS reset jumper (usually near battery), 4) Move jumper from normal position to reset position for 10-15 seconds, 5) Return jumper to normal position, 6) Power on and reconfigure BIOS settings.
